question: In quantum computing, the Hadamard gate is defined as \[ H = \frac{1}{\sqrt{2}} \begin{pmatrix} 1 & 1 \\ 1 & -1 \end{pmatrix}. \] Consider the initial quantum state $|00\rangle$. If we first apply the $H$ gate to the first qubit, followed by a CNOT gate, what is the resulting state?

answers.feedback: Exactly! As you can see, applying these two quantum gates transforms a non-entangled state into an entangled state.
You may have applied the Hadamard gate to the second qubit, instead of the first.
You may have applied the quantum gates in the wrong order.
You may have applied $H \otimes H$, instead of $H \otimes I$ to $|00\rangle.$
